articles.description: David Beckham pays tribute to "true gentleman" Sven-Goran Eriksson and says he will be "forever grateful" to the ex-England manager, who has died aged 76.
articles.title: Sven-Goran Eriksson: David Beckham leads tributes to former England manager

articles.description: Sven-Goran Eriksson was engaging, courteous and a shrewd tactician - and he could, and should, have ended England's trophy drought.
articles.title: Sven-Goran Eriksson obituary: Ex-England manager who could and should have ended trophy drought

articles.description: Defending champion Coco Gauff says she is treating this year's US Open as a "victory lap" after comfortably beating Varvara Gracheva in her opening match.
articles.title: US Open 2024: Coco Gauff beats Varvara Gracheva in first round to start title defence

articles.description: Liverpool are considering a move for Italy attacker Federico Chiesa, who has been deemed surplus to requirements at Juventus.
articles.title: Federico Chiesa: Liverpool consider move for Juventus and Italy winger

articles.description: Dominic Thiem's Grand Slam career comes to an end in the US Open first round as the former New York champion loses to Ben Shelton.
articles.title: US Open 2024 results: Dominic Thiem loses in final major appearance to Ben Shelton, Alexander Zverev through

articles.description: Manchester City agree a £21.2m deal with Saudi Pro League club Al-Hilal to sell defender Joao Cancelo.
articles.title: Joao Cancelo: Manchester City agree deal with Saudi Pro League club Al-Hilal

articles.description: Tanni Grey-Thompson says Paris will want to "move the Paralympic bar up another notch" from London 2012.
articles.title: Paralympics 2024: 'I don’t want London to be best Games ever' - Tanni Grey-Thompson

articles.description: British qualifier Jan Choinski threatens to produce a memorable comeback win on his US Open main draw debut but goes down to Spain's Roberto Carballes Baena in five sets.
articles.title: US Open 2024: Jan Choinski loses in five sets to Roberto Carballes Baena in New York

articles.description: Boston Red Sox catcher Danny Jansen is set to make history as the first player to play for both teams in one Major League Baseball game.
articles.title: MLB: Danny Jansen to become first player to play for both teams in one game

articles.description: England pick five uncapped players for next month's white-ball series against Australia but leave out Jonny Bairstow and Moeen Ali.
articles.title: England v Australia: Jonny Bairstow and Moeen Ali left out as England pick five uncapped players
